intro: Lepidium hirtum var. pubescens, commonly known as hairy peppergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to regions of North America and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Lepidium hirtum var. pubescens is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
